bio: Maria is a classically trained chef who has worked in Michelin-starred restaurants all over the world. Her specialty is French cuisine, but she also loves experimenting with fusion flavors.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 325°F. Brown the beef, then sauté the onions and garlic. Deglaze the pan with red wine, then add the mushrooms and beef back to the pot. Bake for 2-3 hours, until tender.

recipes.name: Fusion Tacos
recipes.cookingMethod: Brown the beef and sauté the peppers and jalapeno. Add the cumin and soy sauce and stir to combine. Serve on tortillas with your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 325°F. Whisk together egg yolks and sugar. Heat cream and vanilla, then slowly pour into egg mixture while whisking. Strain mixture into ramekins and bake for 30-35 minutes. Chill in fridge for 2 hours. Sprinkle brown sugar on top and broil until caramelized.

bio: Mario is an Italian chef who specializes in pasta dishes. He learned to cook from his grandmother and has been passionate about food ever since.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook spaghetti until al dente, then reserve some pasta water. Cook pancetta and garlic in a pan, then remove garlic. Mix egg yolks and Parmesan cheese in a bowl. Add hot pasta and pancetta to egg mixture, then mix well. If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water. Serve with black pepper on top.

recipes.name: Lasagna
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook lasagna noodles until al dente, then rinse in cold water. Cook ground beef and onion in a pan, then add tomato sauce. Layer noodles, beef mixture, and Parmesan cheese in a baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Fettuccine Alfredo
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook fettuccine until al dente, then reserve some pasta water. Melt butter in a pan, then add heavy cream and nutmeg. Add cooked pasta and Parmesan cheese to the pan, then mix well. If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water. Serve with black pepper on top.

recipes.name: Pesto
recipes.cookingMethod: Blend basil leaves, Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and garlic in a food processor. Slowly add olive oil while blending. Serve with pasta or as a spread on bread.

bio: Yoko is a Japanese chef who specializes in sushi and other traditional Japanese dishes. She has trained in some of the most prestigious sushi restaurants in Tokyo.

recipes.name: Spicy Tuna Roll
recipes.cookingMethod: Mix tuna with Sriracha, sesame oil, and soy sauce. Spread mixture onto nori, then roll tightly and cut into slices.

recipes.name: Tempura Shrimp
recipes.cookingMethod: Mix flour, cornstarch, and baking powder. Add ice water and stir until just combined. Dip shrimp in batter and deep fry until golden brown.

recipes.name: Miso Soup
recipes.cookingMethod: Heat dashi stock, then whisk in miso paste. Add cubed tofu and sliced green onion. Serve with sliced nori on top.

bio: Jasmine is a pastry chef who loves creating beautiful and delicious desserts. She has worked in some of the finest restaurants in the world and is known for her intricate designs and attention to detail.

recipes.name: Chocolate Cake
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix dry ingredients in a bowl. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract, then mix well. Add boiling water and mix well. Pour batter into greased pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Let cool before frosting.

recipes.name: Macarons
recipes.cookingMethod: Mix almond flour and powdered sugar in a food processor. Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. Slowly add granulated sugar while beating. Fold in almond mixture. Pipe batter onto parchment paper. Let dry for 30 minutes. Bake at 300°F for 15-20 minutes.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 300°F. Heat cream and sugar in a pan until sugar dissolves. Beat egg yolks and vanilla extract in a bowl. Slowly add cream mixture to egg mixture while stirring. Strain mixture and pour into ramekins. Bake for 45-50 minutes. Let cool and refrigerate. Before serving, sprinkle brown sugar on top and use a torch to caramelize.

bio: Marta is a Spanish chef who specializes in tapas and other traditional Spanish dishes. She loves to use fresh, local ingredients in her cooking.

recipes.name: Tortilla Española
recipes.cookingMethod: Thinly slice potatoes and onions, then sauté until tender. Beat eggs with salt, then mix in potatoes and onions. Cook in olive oil until set.

recipes.name: Gazpacho
recipes.cookingMethod: Blend vegetables in a food processor, then stir in olive oil. Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

recipes.name: Patatas Bravas
recipes.cookingMethod: Cut potatoes into cubes and fry until golden brown. Mix tomato sauce, mayonnaise, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper. Serve potatoes with sauce on top.

bio: Alex is a Vietnamese-American chef who specializes in fusion cuisine. He grew up learning traditional Vietnamese cooking from his grandmother and later trained at some of the top culinary schools in the United States. He is known for his innovative combinations of flavors and textures.

recipes.name: Banh Mi Sandwich
recipes.cookingMethod: Slice the baguette in half and toast it. Spread mayonnaise and sriracha sauce on the inside. Layer pork, pickled vegetables, cucumbers, cilantro, and jalapenos on top. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pho
recipes.cookingMethod: Bring broth to a boil in a pot. Add beef and onion and cook for 3-5 minutes. Cook noodles according to package directions. Divide noodles among bowls. Pour broth over noodles. Top with beef, cilantro, and green onions. Serve with hoisin and fish sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Taco Rice Bowl
recipes.cookingMethod: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Add taco seasoning and mix well. In a bowl, layer rice, beef, beans, corn, tomatoes, jalapenos, and cheese. Serve hot.
